answers.answer: Hello,Diabetic nephropathy is an important complication of diabetes which can cause such swelling. Other causes include infection (cellulitis or septic joint), problems with blood flow like DVT can impair normal circulation and lead to swelling around the ankles,pregnancy, obesity, and varicose veins.Edema can be caused by a serious condition of the kidney, heart, liver or blood vessels, but many other factors can contribute to its onset, including: Eating a poor diet high in salt and carbohydrates , Abusing laxatives,diuretics, drugs, sodium retention, varicose veins, allergic reactions and neuromuscular disorders.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing

question: For the last week or so I have been experiencing severe bloating and/or swelling. This includes my face, hands, ankles, and stomach. And when I say severe I mean I actually look like I am about 7 months pregnant. Other symptoms I have are gas, lower back pain mostly on the right side, very poor vision lately, headaches, muscle weakness, and I am a type 1 diabetic. I feel that my diabetes probably has nothing to do with my other symptoms because I am very well controlled with an insulin pump. And I know for sure that I am not pregnant. Please...what could be wrong with me? I am in misery!
title: help
